title: Britons miss out on £296million in travel tax rebates: How to claim your money back
text:
Britons miss out on £296million in travel tax rebates: How to claim your money back Britons miss out on £296million in travel tax rebates: How to claim your money back BRITISH holidaymakers are failing to claim up to £296million in tax rebates each year after returning from overseas, according to research. PUBLISHED: PUBLISHED: 04:01, Wed, Jul 15, 2015 GETTY Millions of Brits fail to claim travel tax rebates 
Millions of people do not know that VAT or its equivalent paid on purchases abroad can be reclaimed when returning from holiday. The rebates vary by country but are available from European Union (EU) member states, as well as Thailand, Japan and Israel. British travellers spend an average £227 when on holiday buying items such as jewellery and clothing, which could yield a typical rebate of £35. Just one in 14 people have reclaimed the tax in the last two years, according to research by Direct Line Travel Insurance. Almost half of people were not aware they could make a claim. Tom Bishop, head of travel insurance at Direct Line, said: “Getting some of the money you’ve spent back when returning from holiday should be an opportunity too good to miss, but millions of people aren’t taking advantage of it. "We’re big spenders when it comes to shopping abroad, so the tax on these items really does add up and once you have arrived home it will be too late to claim.” Related articles How to build a 24,000 Avios point pot - the clever tricks to get... 
How to claim back tax First, check if your holiday destination offers a VAT or Goods and Services Tax (GST) rebate (see list below). Each country has its own specific rules on claiming back tax, but you will generally need to keep all your receipts from shopping and purchases. Many international airports have dedicated reclaim desks at departure gates and some stores even having their own tax free refund centres where you can make a claim. Give yourself extra time at the airport before leaving to claim back cash, you will usually not be able to reclaim the cash once you are back in Britain. Country VAT rate Average amounts that could be reclaimed on £227 of shopping brought back to the UK• Hungary 27 per cent £61.29• Israel 26.5 per cent £60.16• Croatia 25 per cent £56.75• Greece 23 per cent £52.21• Spain 21 per cent £47.67• France 20 per cent £45.40• Germany 19 per cent £43.13• Thailand seven per cent £15.89 
Source: Direct Line Travel Insurance, 2015
